title: How to Cook Baked Tilapia With Lemon Butter

methods.name: Baked Tilapia with Lemon, Butter, and Capers

steps.headline: Pre-heat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit or 218 degrees Celsius.
steps.description: This will save you time while preparing the fish.

steps.headline: Coat the baking dish with a non-stick cooking spray.
steps.description: This will prevent the fish from sticking to the bottom of the pan. Alternatively, coat the baking sheet with aluminum foil.

steps.headline: Rinse the fillets under cold water and then place them in the baking dish.
steps.description: Spread out the fillets so that they are not touching one another. Be sure to pat the fillets dry with a paper towel or clean dish towel.

steps.headline: Combine the butter, lemon juice, and garlic powder in a small bowl.
steps.description: Pour the mixture evenly over the fish. Use a basting brush if you have one.

steps.headline: Sprinkle capers and oregano over the fish.
steps.description: Add salt and pepper if desired.

steps.headline: Cook the fish, uncovered, for 10-15 minutes.
steps.description: Fish should be white in color (no longer pink) and flaky when pulled apart with a fork.

steps.headline: Serve immediately.
steps.description: Garnish with cilantro or lemon slices if desired.

steps.headline: Pre-heat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit or 190 degrees Celsius.
steps.description: This will save time while cooking. If you don't pre-heat the oven, add 5-10 minutes to the suggested baking time.

steps.headline: Spray a baking dish with non-stick cooking spray.
steps.description: If you don't have cooking spray, then cover the baking dish with aluminum foil.

steps.headline: Rinse tilapia fillets under cool water.
steps.description: Pat dry with a paper towel, and place them side-by-side on the baking dish.

steps.headline: Combine lemon juice and butter in a small bowl.
steps.description: Spread evenly over the fillets using a basting brush if you have one.

steps.headline: Sprinkle with garlic, parsley, and pepper.
Bake the fish, uncovered, for about 30 minutes.
steps.description: The fish should be white and flaky when pulled apart with a fork.

steps.headline: Serve immediately.
steps.description: Garnish with lemon slices or parsley if desired.

tyn: Non-stick cooking spray or aluminum foil
text: Baked Tilapia with Lemon, Butter, and Capers Pre-heat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit or 218 degrees Celsius. This will save you time while preparing the fish. Coat the baking dish with a non-stick cooking spray. This will prevent the fish from sticking to the bottom of the pan. Alternatively, coat the baking sheet with aluminum foil. Rinse the fillets under cold water and then place them in the baking dish. Spread out the fillets so that they are not touching one another. Be sure to pat the fillets dry with a paper towel or clean dish towel. Combine the butter, lemon juice, and garlic powder in a small bowl. Pour the mixture evenly over the fish. Use a basting brush if you have one. Sprinkle capers and oregano over the fish. Add salt and pepper if desired. Cook the fish, uncovered, for 10-15 minutes. Fish should be white in color (no longer pink) and flaky when pulled apart with a fork. Serve immediately. Garnish with cilantro or lemon slices if desired. Lemon Garlic Tilapia Pre-heat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit or 190 degrees Celsius. This will save time while cooking. If you don't pre-heat the oven, add 5-10 minutes to the suggested baking time. Spray a baking dish with non-stick cooking spray. If you don't have cooking spray, then cover the baking dish with aluminum foil. Rinse tilapia fillets under cool water. Pat dry with a paper towel, and place them side-by-side on the baking dish. Combine lemon juice and butter in a small bowl. Spread evenly over the fillets using a basting brush if you have one. Sprinkle with garlic, parsley, and pepper. Add additional seasonings if desired. Bake the fish, uncovered, for about 30 minutes. The fish should be white and flaky when pulled apart with a fork. Serve immediately. Garnish with lemon slices or parsley if desired.

This will save you time while preparing the fish.
Coat the baking dish with a non-stick cooking spray.
This will prevent the fish from sticking to the bottom of the pan.
Alternatively, coat the baking sheet with aluminum foil.
Rinse the fillets under cold water and then place them in the baking dish.
Spread out the fillets so that they are not touching one another.
Be sure to pat the fillets dry with a paper towel or clean dish towel.
Combine the butter, lemon juice, and garlic powder in a small bowl.
Pour the mixture evenly over the fish.
Use a basting brush if you have one.
Sprinkle capers and oregano over the fish.
Add salt and pepper if desired.
Cook the fish, uncovered, for 10-15 minutes.
Fish should be white in color (no longer pink) and flaky when pulled apart with a fork.
Serve immediately.
Garnish with cilantro or lemon slices if desired.
Lemon Garlic Tilapia Pre-heat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit or 190 degrees Celsius.
This will save time while cooking.
If you don't pre-heat the oven, add 5-10 minutes to the suggested baking time.
Spray a baking dish with non-stick cooking spray.
If you don't have cooking spray, then cover the baking dish with aluminum foil.
Rinse tilapia fillets under cool water.
Pat dry with a paper towel, and place them side-by-side on the baking dish.
Combine lemon juice and butter in a small bowl.
Spread evenly over the fillets using a basting brush if you have one.
Sprinkle with garlic, parsley, and pepper.
Add additional seasonings if desired.
Bake the fish, uncovered, for about 30 minutes.
The fish should be white and flaky when pulled apart with a fork.
Serve immediately.
Garnish with lemon slices or parsley if desired.
